p: China is second only to India [ 4] in terms of the national number of human rabies cases, and in recent years the prevalence of rabies has increased in some areas of China [ 5]. More than 90% of human rabies cases in China occur in rural regions [ 6] where the proportion of vaccinated dogs is very low [ 7]. Additionally, China has a growing population of dogs, currently estimated at 80â€“200 million animals [ 6], and the breeding, management, and vaccination of dogs in the country is uncontrolled [ 8]. A better quantitative understanding of rabies epidemiology in dogs is needed to help predict future vaccine demand in China and other developing countries.
